abstract: The Treasury Department recently unveiled its plan to lift mortgage-linked securities off banks’ balance sheets. But Citigroup and Bank of America have been buying those assets in a hurry from the secondary market, The New York Post reported.
lead_paragraph: The Treasury Department recently unveiled its plan to lift mortgage-linked securities off banks’ balance sheets. But Citigroup and Bank of America have been buying those assets in a hurry from the secondary market, The New York Post reported.

headline.main: Citi, Bank of America Buy Mortgage Securities in Bulk

abstract: Kenneth Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, says the company is gearing up to pay the government back its $45 billion investment in the firm, possibly by the end of the year. But some analysts were skeptical it could do so.
lead_paragraph: Kenneth Lewis, the chief executive of Bank of America, says the company is gearing up to pay the government back its $45 billion investment in the firm, possibly by the end of the year. But some analysts were skeptical it could do so.

headline.main: BofA Chief Says TARP Funds May Be Repaid This Year

abstract: Two of the biggest players in the reckless buildup of Bank of America and First Union continue to collect a paycheck or perks from their former employers.
snippet: Two of the biggest players in the reckless buildup of Bank of America and First Union continue to collect a paycheck or perks from their former employers.
lead_paragraph: FOR much of the 1990s and the early part of this decade, a small group of men built financial behemoths by snapping up ever larger competitors and adding branches with almost reckless abandon in an attempt to build truly national banks that stretched from Florida to Alaska.

headline.main: As Banks Flounder, the Perks Play On
headline.print_headline: As Banks Flounder, the Perks Play On
